message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS 

This paper is about improving the performance of text categorization through supervised term weighting. It discusses various techniques to control the trade-off between over-weighting and under-weighting, which are important considerations in text categorization. These topics are relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). However, given the focus on text categorization, cs.IR and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.DS.
